summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Laura Menninger and prosecutor Christian Everdell regarding a proposed protective order for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The defense argues for equal protections for defense witnesses and proposes allowing Maxwell to review discovery on a laptop while in custody.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, proposing protective order terms and advocating for Maxwell's access to discovery materials while in custody.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Government attorney receiving and forwarding the proposed protective order from defense counsel.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the protective order.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the protective order.

connections.description: Menninger is defense counsel representing Maxwell in the criminal case.
Prosecutor and defense attorney negotiating protective order terms in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Protective Order Proposal
events.description: Defense counsel submits proposed protective order for discovery materials in Ghislaine Maxwell case, addressing concerns about pretrial publicity and access to evidence.

locations: MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, likely in New York)
Denver, Colorado 80203 (Haddon, Morgan and Foreman law office)
New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser law office)
keyFacts: Defense proposed a protective order to prevent trial by press and protect defense witnesses from harassment.
Defense argued that government witnesses and prospective witnesses had violated rules regarding pretrial publicity.
Defense requested the government provide a laptop with all discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell while she was in custody at MDC.
The defense removed the 'Highly Confidential' category from the protective order proposal, questioning what materials would warrant such designation.
The correspondence shows ongoing pretrial negotiations about evidence handling and witness protections in mid-2020.
